page.description: Draws a bitmap using a different bitmap an alpha-value.
page.syntax: V BITMAP_ALPHA(C bitmap_name,N XPos,N YPos,C level_bitmap)

argument.name: bitmap_name
argument.description: The name of the bitmap to modify.

argument.name: XPos
argument.description: The horizontal coordinate of the upper left corner of the bitmap.

argument.name: YPos
argument.description: The vertical coordinate of the upper left corner of the bitmap.

argument.name: level_bitmap
argument.description: The name of the bitmap to use as the alpha channel. A pixel value of 0 is completely transparent. A pixel value of 255 is completely opaque. Intermediate values represent degrees of transparency.

page.discussion: BITMAP_ALPHA() sets the transparency of each of the pixels in a bitmap according to the values of the corresponding pixels in an alpha channel bitmap, then draws the result.

section.title: Example
section.description: Get the original color image, then extract the color data and the alpha channel data.
section.example: png_data = file.to_blob("c:\documents\Xbasic Reference\Images\toucan.png") rgb_data = png_to_bitmap(png_data, "R") trans_data = png_to_bitmap(png_data, "A")

section.description: Create two bitmaps from the color data and the alpha channel data.
Calculate the positions of the three images.
section.example: pixsize = ui_bitmap_info_get(rgb_data, "w,h") xpix = val( word(pixsize, 1, ",") ) ypix = val( word(pixsize, 2, ",") ) xperin = ui_info(4) yperin = ui_info(5) width = xpix/xperin height = ypix/yperin

ui_bitmap_create("combine", width, height) stone_data = file.to_blob("C:\WINDOWS\Greenstone.bmp") ui_bitmap_load("Stone", stone_data) ui_bitmap_draw("combine", <<%code% bitmap("stone", 0, 0) bitmap_alpha("rgb", 0, 0, "trans") %code%)

page.limitations: Used only in the Code sections of UI_BITMAP_DRAW(), UI_SCREEN_DRAW(), and UI_PRINTER_DRAW().
